entry.title: Return of the plane evolute
entry.summary: Below we consider the evolutes of plane real-algebraic curves and discuss some of their complex and real-algebraic properties. In particular, for a given degree $d\ge 2$, we provide lower bounds for the following four numerical invariants: 1) the maximal number of times a real line can intersect the evolute of a real-algebraic curve of degree $d$; 2) the maximal number of real cusps which can occur on the evolute of a real-algebraic curve of degree $d$; 3) the maximal number of (cru)nodes which can occur on the dual curve to the evolute of a real-algebraic curve of degree $d$; 4) the maximal number of (cru)nodes which can occur on the evolute of a real-algebraic curve of degree $d$.
